instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing twice no power
threads.message:
Clean board, all S4, S3 and S0 rails including VCORE pulse 2 times before board shutdown, after that all S5 rails remain present and all other ones above that stay off.

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pins 17-18 and 27-28 resistance is correct.

SMC bypass does the same thing.

Clean BIOS same thing.

Re-balled SMC just in case and same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing twice no power
threads.message:
Looks like CPU problem.
Just in case, check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.
